definitions.definition: One's independent faculty of choice; the ability to be able to exercise one's choice or intention.
definitions.example: Of course, man's will is often regulated by his reason.

definitions.definition: One's intention or decision; someone's orders or commands.
definitions.example: Eventually I submitted to my parents' will.

definitions.definition: The act of choosing to do something; a person’s conscious intent or volition.
definitions.example: Most creatures have a will to live.

definitions.definition: Law A formal declaration of one's intent concerning the disposal of one's property and holdings after death; the legal document stating such wishes.
That which is desired; one's wish.
Desire, longing. (Now generally merged with later senses.)
definitions.example: He felt a great will to make a pilgrimage to the Holy Land.

definitions.definition: To instruct (that something be done) in one's will.
To try to make (something) happen by using one's will (intention).
definitions.example: All the fans were willing their team to win the game.

definitions.definition: To bequeath (something) to someone in one's will (legal document).
definitions.example: He willed his stamp collection to the local museum.
